## NetscriptPort.write() method

Write data to a port.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
write(value: string | number): PortData | null;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  value | string \| number |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

[PortData](./bitburner.portdata.md) \| null

The data popped off the queue if it was full.
